questionTitle: <u><font color='red'>A large number of</font></u> <u><font color='red'>students</font></u> in this school <u><font color='red'>speaks</font></u> French <u><font color='red'>fairly fluently</font></u>.

- Jim: <u><font color='red'>Did</font></u> she <u><font color='red'>use to be</font></u> your next-door neighbor? - Jack: Yes, but I <u><font color='red'>never</font></u> did <u><font color='red'>liked</font></u> her.

Joan: Could I have another spoonful of your delightful pudding? Maud: Oh dear, there doesn't seem to be ________.
I shall go on working on the farm ________ I can.
Yes, sir. I'll ask Mr Smith to ________ to you as soon as he returns.
A camera works by letting light through a small ________ at the front.
You will have to ________ your holiday if you are too ill to travel.
If we go to the market we might find a ________.
The plane was ________ by two hours because of bad weather.
Our guests didn't leave until 2 a.m., so they ________ have enjoyed themselves.
Eve was sitting just ________ Peter and Harry.
She remembered the correct address only ________ she had posted the letter.
I have never ________ any experience of living in the country.
Could you lend me some money? I'm very ________ of cash at the moment.
The ________ were told to fasten their seat belts as the plane began its descent.

If they had been able ________ it for you, they would have done it.
